titlestmt.titleproper: Women in Animation oral history transcripts

did.unittitle: Women in Animation oral history transcripts
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of receipt unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Women in Animation oral history transcripts (Collection 222). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of oral history transcripts from interviews conducted by the organization, Women in Animation. Contains interviews with women pioneers from the animation industry, including Frances Arriola, Susan Ashley, Barbara Baldwin, Betty Brooks, Martha Buckley, Xenia De Mattia, Becky Fallberg, Mary Jane Frost, Grace Godino, Wilma Guenot, Julie Harvey, Anneline Liu, Joan Orbison, Sylvia Roemer, Martha Sigall, Gini Swift and Auril Thompson. The interviews are varied in terms of positions held and talents expressed while in the animation industry.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.
